meanings.definition: The longevities of different species vary greatly.
meanings.sent1: The longevities of turtles can be astonishingly long.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the longevities of various animals to understand aging.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the longest longevities in the animal kingdom is fierce.
meanings.sent4: In the race of longevities, the tortoise often beats the hare.
meanings.sent5: The longevities of trees make them seem almost immortal.

meanings.definition: The longevities of our ancestors were much shorter.
meanings.sent1: Our ancestors' longevities were not as long as ours today.
meanings.sent2: History books often mention the longevities of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: Imagine the surprise on our ancestors' faces if they saw our longevities now.
meanings.sent4: The longevities of past generations seem like a different world.
meanings.sent5: The short longevities of early humans shaped their way of life.

meanings.definition: The longevities of these batteries are impressive.
meanings.sent1: The longevities of these batteries make them worth the investment.
meanings.sent2: Consumers look for products with longevities to save money in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The longevities of these batteries outlast all others on the market.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electronics, longevities are a key selling point.
meanings.sent5: The longevities of these batteries defy expectations and last for years.
